tool.name: Anova
tool.description: N-way anova. With ou Without interactions
tool.command: Rscript $__tool_directory__/abims_anova.r file '$input' sampleinfo '$sampleinfo' varinfo '$varinfo' mode '$mode' condition "c('$condition_1' #for $i, $s in enumerate( $conditions ) ,'${s.condition}' #end for )" interaction $interaction method $method threshold $threshold selection_method $selection_method sep '$sep' dec '$dec' outputdatapvalue '$varMetaPValue' outputdatasignif '$dataSignif'

param.name: input
param.label: Data Matrix file
param.help: Matrix of numeric data with headers.

param.name: sampleinfo
param.label: Sample Metadata file
param.help: Tabular file with the data metadata : one sample per line and at least two columns : ids and one condition

param.name: varinfo
param.label: Variable Metadata file
param.help: Tabular file with information about your tested variables. Only used to aggregate generated information.

param.name: mode
param.help: Perform the anova tests on column/row
param.label: Mode

param.name: condition_1
param.label: Condition
param.help: The column name of the condition. ex: hour or treatment

param.name: condition
param.label: Condition
param.help: The column name of the condition. ex: hour or treatment

param.name: interaction
param.label: Enable interaction response p-values
param.help: Used if more than 1 conditon. The anova will produse p-value according to the interaction between your condition (ex: condition1:conditions2, condition1:conditions3, condition2:conditions3 and condition1:condition2:conditions3)

param.name: method
param.help: Method used to apply a correction on the pvalue because of the number of test
param.label: PValue adjusted method

param.name: selection_method
param.help: Intersection: all condition p-value must be under the threshold. Union: at least condition p-value must be under the threshold.
param.label: Selection method

.. class:: infomark
**Authors** Gildas Le Corguille ABiMS - UPMC/CNRS - Station Biologique de Roscoff - gildas.lecorguille|at|sb-roscoff.fr
---------------------------------------------------
===== Anova =====
----------- Description -----------
Analysis of variance (ANOVA) is used to analyze the differences between group means and their associated procedures, in which the observed variance in a particular variable is partitioned into components attributable to different sources of variation.
----------- Input files -----------
+----------------------------+------------+ | Parameter : num + label | Format | +============================+============+ | 1 : Data Matrix file | Tabular | +----------------------------+------------+ | 2 : Sample Metadata file | Tabular | +----------------------------+------------+ | 3 : Variable Metadata file | Tabular | +----------------------------+------------+
------------ Output files ------------
***.anova_pvalue.tabular**
| Your variable metadata file completed with columns of p-values, result of selection method and means of subgroups.
***.anova_signif.pdf**
| A pdf file containing a Venn diagram and boxplots of significant variables.
------
.. class:: infomark
The outputs ***.anova_filtered.tabular** is a tabular file. You can continue your analysis using it in the following tools:
| Generic_filter | Hierarchical Clustering
